comment: It's unfortunate for students that she is retiring after this semester, but definitely am happy for her! She provided great feedback and truly cared about students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Her classes were never boring, and I as a person who has hated literature since high school, she guides you into writing and all the assignments which are easy guide you to write an essay. She truly cares about students and they're for their voices to be heard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Respected

comment: Great professor. Follow the rubric and participate in the group discussions and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Loverde-Dropp is a sweet lady and gave nice and constructive feedback. I actually ended this class with a 102%. As long as you follow the rubrics, its a piece of cake. She gave me extra credit on all of my papers and many assignments. Just show that you care about the material and that you have a clear understanding and youre golden!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor LoVerde was great. Her class was very straightforward, and she gave very detailed instructions/rubrics. She encouraged students to email her to ask questions, and she answered very quickly. The class was not hard. Only three essays and a couple assignments leading up to each essay. Very easy A if you turn your work in and read the rubric.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: shes really nice and an easy grader. the readings we had to do werent super fun but it wasnt anything too difficult

She is the sweetest lady ever!! As long as you do the work and show that you care youre going to pass. I would recommend her 100 times over! I took her online and I was a major procrastinator it she allowed me to make up assignments . Love her!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Professor LoVerde-Dropp was honestly the best professor I have ever had. Assignments were easy and due every Sunday. The readings were also very interesting. She always emailed back within reasonable time. Loved this class so much!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Easiest English class. Easy A
Very flexible and doesnt require too much of your time. Major assignments are done in steps every week so you shouldnt feel overwhelmed by essays. Just do your work as best you can and youll pass
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor LoVerde one of the best professors . The class is organized and i think you can easy get an A just reading the stories and do your work on time. Discussion question every week or an assignment but easy , 3 exams which are essays around 500 words. Besides the class is easy she gives extra credit. I took this class fully online . Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Although it was online, she did a great job. She is easy to get in contact with and gives great feedback. Her discussions and test are over the books she provides, but they are fairly easy. The test are just like 500 word responses. Take her, great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Very caring and kind. The workload isn't bad at all, just reading stories from different parts of the world. Every assignment is very well detailed with a very specific rubric so you know exactly what you need to do. She also writes out a well-defined schedule to make planning easy. 10/10

Overall, great professor. Accepts late work without much penalty, is quick to get back to emails, offers extra credit, is very clear about what she wants for assignment, gives check lists every week, very positive, passionate about English, and the emails you about major missing assignments. You do have to put in work but not over work yourself.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Caring

comment: Very easy teacher. She has clear expectations, and as long as you meet those, you'll be golden. Always willing to help if you reach out, and she's extremely nice, so nothing to be afraid of. She does not accept only one analysis/point of view on your assignments, so it's hard to do bad if you can write clearly. Overall 10/10. Easy to stay ahead.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: Literally such a caring and awesome person.  10/10 would recommend for English 1101. Literally an hour of work a week.  Alongside the fact that she is such an amazing human being.

Professor Dropp is absolutely amazing. I originally signed up to have her as an in-person class. However, corona forced me to take it online. She is one of the clearest professors I have ever had. She tells you exactly what needs to be done and when it needs to be done. I highly recommend choosing Professor Dropp if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Prof Loverde-Dropp provides an easy curriculum! Short assignments every week and three "essay" exams. However, you'll definitely need to read through the assigned texts to do your assignment. There are way less assigned texts compared to an in-class world lit course. Extremely organized schedule and provides a checklist of things to do per week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Loved her! You do have to buy a book that you use throughout the semester. There are alot of class discussions but they are interesting. There are several essays and projects but they are not too difficult. Overall a great class and would take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Dropp is a great professor. I took her online and got an A. It was not an easy A, but it also was not difficult. If you do the work and follow the rubric, you will get an A. She also offers extra credit at the end if you complete a survey. Take her!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Dropp is great! She really cares about her students , even in an online environment. You have 3 tests 2 are short essays and about one short assignment a week based on some reading. She gives a clear rubric , if followed for assignments youll do well. YOU WILL NEED TO READ
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: She is a solid choice! Few paper tests but super short! Nothing like a 4 page paper or anything! Super enjoyable and easy class! She is extremely caring and organized! 100% take her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: She was such a sweet professor!! Has a clear grading rubric! Tests are essays, where you get three options and choose one. Not overly complicated though. Never gave too much work- assignments opened Mondays and were due Sundays. She always gives great feedback and wants everyone to succeed. 100% recommend taking this course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Ms. LoVerde-Dropp has been my favorite teacher so far at KSU! Her workload is light and flows simply throughout the semester. She responds to emails quickly and is very easy to talk to. I passed every assignment and even if you don't she allows at the end for revisions to certain things so it's an easy class to take highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: Professor JoAnn LoVerde-Dropp was great! She grades fair and cares about her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took her online and it was easy. No quizzes, papers for the texts, typically one assignment due a week, couple discussion posts. We did have to get the textbook to read and cite from. There is a bit of reading but nothing unbearable. She grades super easily and is extremely caring and nice. 100% recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: I took her class online. LOVE. There were only three essays and the third one was a revision of one of the two first ones. Her feedback was very helpful and as long as you follow it, youll do well on your essays. I asked for help in an email and within an hour she responded with a thorough explanation and it helped a lot. Super caring, recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor who give good feedback. We do a module every week with 1 reading assignment. Papers aren't the usually 10 page essays. Its like a paragraph. Same for tests. The final was multiple choice but was easy. She'll email you back fairly quickly. Sometimes the assignments aren't as clear as they could be but you could email her. Easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The best online class and teacher I have taken. She is a very kind soul, and really cares about her students. Her work load is very manageable, and the content contains some very interesting stuff. Her organization and the way she spreads out of the work is superb and works in your favor. I would definitely take her if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: easiest english i have taken at KSU. this class is just 100% busy work and then tests you can easily BS and get a 100. If you dont get a A in this class then i really dont know what to say. The professor is very kind and willing to compensate with probelms going on to prevent you from doing an assignment. takes a very long time to give back grades
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Take her!! She's very kind and attentive. The work isn't something you can just look up on Quizlet, but as long as you read & do the work you're basically guaranteed an A. (coming from someone who HATES reading). She offers a ton of extra credit at the end of the semester (simple as answering an extra question on a test). I definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: TAKE HER! One of my favorite professors. I truly enjoyed the semester. She is so sweet. The due dates of assignments are well spread out. The assignments are not hard. She creates a great atmosphere in the classroom. Would love to take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. This is my third online English class (1101 & 1102), and she is by far the best English professor I have had. She usually only assigns one thing per week, like one short discussion post or a short 250-500 word essay for the exams. No actual "papers". She's very accessible and nice, and really cares about students' success!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof Loverde-Dropp is SO amazing!! The workload is not a lot at all. We read a couple short stories per week and had a discussion and/or quiz on one of the readings. She grades extremely fairly and the assignments are not hard if you put in minimum effort. She also is understanding if you need an extension on an assignment for a good reason.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I took this class online and it is TOO MUCH WORK!!! If you are an adult learner, meaning you're in school and work full time, try to find a different professor. Take her as a last resort. She is however, a very nice person!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: I loveee this professor, she is such a sweet lady. She is soo helpful and doesn't require too from her students. She responds to emails in a timely manner and willingly provides help for students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Because it is an English class, there is naturally a fair amount of out of class work (mostly papers). However, the assignments are very well spaced and the assignment is given well before the deadline. It did not feel overwhelming in the slightest. Love this professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Great teacher. She makes class interesting and doesn't require students to do a lot of work. It is English so expect a little reading, but they weren't boring and we also didn't have any quizzes on them. We had 3 essays, but she ended up making the last one extra credit. Just do the work and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: For not being interested in different types of literature, I actually found myself enjoying the stories that we were assigned to read. She posted videos weekly on what she wanted you to accomplish for the week and made it very clear on what you were supposed to do. Most of the work can be accomplished within a few hours, take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I took her for an online summer class. She was very organized and for the summer class there was not a lot of work which was nice. Had a module every week that usually included a short reading then a quiz and/or discussion. I didn't consider any of it hard. Just do all of it and you'll make an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She was an amazing teacher. I took her hybrid class and found it very enjoyable. I am taking her again this next semester in a 100% online class. Her availability was amazing and she responded to emails within the hour.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Respected

comment: This class is really good, especially for people just starting college. She understands that students have other classes, sports, plans, etc. Her essays are easier and shorter than most other Comp I professors. She also gives a lot less assignments. She grades fairly easy as long as you follow the directions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor LoVerde was a really solid teacher. She gives plenty of essays, but they are simple and there is clear grading criteria. She gives good feedback and offers extra credit if you go to the writing lab. You only use the book like 3 times and we didn't need the writers reference book. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor L-D is such a sweet person, but I really did not enjoy the class. She tells you to buy three books, and we barely used two of them and never the third. She gives clear rubrics, but takes forever to put grades in, and then doesn't give clear feedback on why points are taken off. The class overall was okay and no midterm or final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy class, heavy amount of writing assignments. Just participate in class get on her good side. She's really strict about attendance, but that has to do with the department apparently. Would highly recommend the class just show up.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Great teacherr.  Highly recommend.  Easy A  Not much work online.

She was okay. Super strict when it comes to attendance. Gives quizzes every day to make sure you go. She dropped your lowest three though. No Final.  It's not too hard, but you do have to put in some work to get an A. She's pretty nice, but she's not the Easy A English teacher we all desire for.
Very helpful and kind. Always willing to go into more detail if you do not understand. I am not good at writing papers but I did fairly well in her class.

Only used the textbook a little bit. Very confusing grading criteria, takes ages to get assignments graded and back to you. Shes very nice and she will push things back if the class wants it, but her attendance policy is ridiculously tough and I cant really say I learned anything in the class.

Professor Loverde is a very kind and patient woman. If she likes your class, he class can be fun to go to and sometimes she changes due dates because she understands we have a lot going on. I never made below a B on any of the assignments and she drops your two or three lowest quiz grades. Do your work, participate, and be kind and you will do well

I took her as hybrid course. She was not very helpful in my opinion. She was not a tough grader  at all. Just do the work and you'll pass. It is a lot of reading and you HAVE to get all the textbooks.

She was a great professor! She really strives to be sure each student understands the material. The work isn't hard, but there is a lot. If you make a decent attempt at your papers and other work, you'll get an A most likely. Lowest paper grade for me was a 92.

Great teacher. I took her hybrid and didnt stress over her class at all the whole semester. Shes nice and understanding, has a pretty strict no phone policy but I'd high recommend her. Only 3 absences I think.
She's great! I took her hybrid and it was great she's very clear on what she wants you to do. I would take her again.

She has a limit of 6 absences and you don't get credit for the course. Her instructions for the essays are very clear, and when you get the essays back, she gives good feedback. Participation is a must, because she gives you bonus points that go toward your overall grade. She can also give pop-quizzes when people dont participate enough.
She is very helpful if you don't understand instructions for an assignment given. Very understanding in certain situations and makes a class I've usually had issues with very easy-flowing.
I'd take her class over any other professor that I've had. She understands and she cares.

If you don't like reading don't take this class. So much reading. She requires "analysis" for ALL her readings so unless you're good at making up hypotheses or inferences don't take her. Participation is based on if you talk during the discussions (she gives you check marks). Miss more than 2 classes and you get a letter drop.

She gives a lot of assignments, but they are easy assignments. If you need help, just email her through D2L and she will get back to you. Participation and attendance is a must to pass this class also.

Took her Technical Writing class over the summer. Quite a bit of work, but the assignments are easy and straightforward. She's willing to help and wants you to understand whatever she's going over. Attendance is huge to her, so show up to class. Do that and the work, and you will get an A.
Good professor. Do the assignments, journals, and SHOW UP TO CLASS. Attendance is huge with her. Do that and you'll get an A.

If your trying to find an English teacher at SPSU that is easy to understand, FUN, WANTS THEIR CLASS TO PASS, and ACCESIBLE WHEN NEEDED then u want to take Professor Loverde's class. ALL U REALLY HAVE TO DO IS GO TO CLASS AND U R ALMOST GURANTEED TO PASS.
